qbraid.devices.google package¶

Submodules¶

qbraid.devices.google.device module¶

Module for Cirq device-like object wrappers.

class CirqSimulatorWrapper(name, provider, **fields)[source]¶

Bases: qbraid.devices.device.DeviceLikeWrapper

Wrapper class for Google Cirq Simulator objects.

Create CirqSimulatorWrapper

Parameters

  • name (str) – a Cirq supported device

  • provider (str) – the provider that this device comes from

  • fields – kwargs for the values to use to override the default options.

Raises

DeviceError – if input field not a valid options

run(run_input, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Samples from the given Circuit. By default, the run_async method invokes this method on another thread. So this method is supposed to be thread safe.

Parameters

  • run_input – The circuit, i.e. program, to sample from.

  • kwargs – param_resolver: Parameters to run with the program. repetitions (int): The number of times to sample.

Returns

Result for a run.

class CirqEngineWrapper(name, provider, **fields)[source]¶

Bases: qbraid.devices.device.DeviceLikeWrapper

Wrapper class for Google Cirq Engine objects. NOTE: Right now the CirqEngine only allows privelaged access, so this class has not been tested.

Creat a CirqEngineWrapper

Parameters

  • name (str) – a Cirq supported device

  • provider (str) – the provider that this device comes from

  • fields – kwargs for the values to use to override the default options.

Raises

DeviceError – if input field not a valid options

run(run_input, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Runs the supplied Circuit via Quantum Engine.

Parameters

  • run_input – The Circuit to execute. If a circuit is provided, a moment by moment schedule will be used.

  • kwargs – Any kwarg options to pass to the backend for running the config. If a key is also present in the options attribute/object then the expectation is that the value specified will be used instead of what’s set in the options object.

Returns

A CirqResultWrapper representing the Result for this run.

run_sweep(run_input, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Runs the supplied Circuit via Quantum Engine.Creates

In contrast to run, this runs across multiple parameter sweeps, and does not block until a result is returned.

Parameters

  • run_input – The Circuit to execute. If a circuit is provided, a moment by moment schedule will be used.

  • kwargs – Any kwarg options to pass to the backend for running the config. If a key is also present in the options attribute/object then the expectation is that the value specified will be used instead of what’s set in the options object.

Returns

An EngineJob. If this is iterated over it returns a list of TrialResults, one for each parameter sweep.

qbraid.devices.google.job module¶

CirqEngineJobWrapper Class

class CirqEngineJobWrapper(device, vendor_jlo)[source]¶

Bases: qbraid.devices.job.JobLikeWrapper

Wrapper class for Google Cirq EngineJob objects.

Create a CirqEngineJobWrapper

Parameters

  • device – the CirqEngineDeviceWrapper associated with this job

  • vendor_jlo (EngineJob) – a Cirq EngineJob object used to run circuits.

property job_id¶

Return the unique ID of the job within the parent program.

metadata(**kwargs)[source]¶

Returns the labels of the job.

result()[source]¶

Returns the job results, blocking until the job is complete.

status()[source]¶

Return the execution status of the job.

cancel()[source]¶

Cancel the job.

qbraid.devices.google.result module¶

CirqResultWrapper Class

class CirqResultWrapper(cirq_result)[source]¶

Bases: qbraid.devices.result.ResultWrapper

Cirq Result wrapper class.

Create a CirqResultWrapper

Parameters

cirq_result (Result) – a Cirq Result object

data(**kwargs)[source]¶

Return a DataFrame with columns as measurement keys, rows as repetitions, and a big endian integer for individual measurements. Note that when a numpy array is produced from this data frame, Pandas will try to use np.int64 as dtype, but will upgrade to object if any value is too large to fit.

Return type

DataFrame
